IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHRYSALIS HOUSE, INC., ESTABLISHED IN 1978, PROVIDES SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER TREATMENT TO WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES. CHRYSALIS HOUSE, INC. PROVIDES A SAFE, NURTURING, AND AESTHETICALLY PLEASING ENVIRONMENT FOR ADULT RECOVERING WOMEN AND THEIR CHILDREN. WE RECOGNIZE THE DISEASE CONCEPT OF ADDICTION AND INCORPORATE THE TWELVE STEP PROGRAMS WHILE INFUSING EVIDENCE BASED PRACTICES INTO EVERY ASPECT OF OUR TREATMENT PROGRAM. WE BELIEVE THAT ADDICTIONS AND MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS AFFECT EVERY ASPECT OF A WOMAN'S FUNCTIONING, AND THE "WHOLE" WOMAN MUST BE TREATED IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE HEALTH, HAPPINESS, AND SERENITY. WE ACCEPT EACH RESIDENT AS A WORTHWHILE INDIVIDUAL, AND TREAT ALL WITH DIGNITY AND RESPECT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF CHRYSALIS HOUSE INC. IS TO SUPPORT WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES IN RECOVERY FROM ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG ADDICTION.
IRS990.Desc: CHRYSALIS HOUSE IS LICENSED AS AN ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG ENTITY (AODE) AND AS A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICE ORGANIZATION (BHSO) BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY TO PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL/TRANSITIONAL SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT, INTENSIVE OUTPATIENT, AND OUTPATIENT SERVICES AT THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS:1588 HILL RISE DRIVE, LEXINGTON KY 4050416 RESIDENTIAL BEDS FOR PREGNANT OR PARENTING, ADULT WOMEN WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER.CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 2 MAY RESIDE FULL-TIME WITH THEIR MOTHERS; OLDER CHILDREN MAY VISIT ON WEEKENDS.120 CHRYSALIS COURT, LEXINGTON, KY 4050816 RESIDENTIAL BEDS FOR PREGNANT OR PARENTING, ADULT WOMEN WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER.CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 2 MAY RESIDE FULL-TIME WITH THEIR MOTHERS; OLDER CHILDREN MAY VISIT ON WEEKENDS.251 E. MAXWELL STREET, LEXINGTON, KY 4050814 RESIDENTIAL BEDS FOR WOMEN WITHOUT CURRENT PARENTING RESPONSIBILITIES. PREGNANT WOMEN MAY RESIDE IN THIS FACILITY AS NEEDED. CHRYSALIS HOUSE'S MISSION TO SUPPORT WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES IN RECOVERY FROM ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUGS LED TO OUR FAMILY-CENTERED APPROACH TO TREATMENT. FAMILY-CENTERED TREATMENT MEETS THE NEED FOR PARENTAL TREATMENT FOR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND THE NEED FOR SUPPORT SERVICES. AT CHRYSALIS HOUSE WE FOCUS PRIMARILY ON THE INDIVIDUAL WOMAN BUT ADDRESS FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS AS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE TREATMENT PROCESS. WE SERVE WOMEN WHO MAY OR MAY NOT HAVE CHILDREN, SINGLE WOMEN, SENIOR WOMEN, YOUNG WOMEN, HOMELESS WOMEN, PREGNANT WOMEN, WOMEN WHO HAVE LOST CUSTODY OF THEIR CHILDREN, AND WOMEN WHOSE MINOR CHILDREN ARE WITH OTHER CARETAKERS. ALTHOUGH SERVICES FOCUS ON THE WOMEN'S TREATMENT AND RECOVERY, OUR SERVICES ARE DELIVERED IN A MANNER THAT RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF FAMILIES AND RELATIONSHIPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES AT CHRYSALIS COMMUNITY CENTER ARE THOSE THAT EXTEND BEYOND RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT. THE AVAILABILITY OF THESE SERVICES HELPS ENSURE THAT TREATMENT CAN BE SUSTAINED IN LONG-TERM RECOVERY. CHRYSALIS HOUSE BELIEVES ONGOING RECOVERY AND COMMUNITY SUPPORT IS ESSENTIAL FOR WOMEN WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS TO MAKE THE CHANGES NECESSARY TO ADOPT AN ALCOHOL- AND DRUG-FREE LIFESTYLE. CHRYSALIS HOUSE STAFF ASSIST WOMEN DEVELOP RECOVERY SUPPORT NETWORKS, RELAPSE PREVENTION TOOLS, AND HOUSING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. PARTICIPATION IN ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, NARCOTICS ANONYMOUS, AL-ANON, AND OTHER RECOVERY SUPPORT NETWORKS IS A VALUABLE RESOURCE FOR MANY RECOVERING WOMEN. RELAPSE PREVENTION AND CONTINUING CARE ARE RECOVERY MANAGEMENT SERVICES. COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES EXTENDING BEYOND TREATMENT INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 1. HOUSING SERVICES - ADEQUATE HOUSING IS ESSENTIAL TO ATTAIN BOTH SAFETY AND SECURITY. CHRYSALIS HOUSE HAS A SPECIAL OUTREACH PROGRAM (SUPPORTIVE HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES FOR WOMEN) TO ACCESS RENTAL SUBSIDIES, AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPTIONS, AND HOUSING PLACEMENT SERVICES FOR ELIGIBLE CLIENTS. 2. FAMILY STRENGTHENING - RECOGNIZING THE FAMILY DISRUPTION THAT IS COMMON TO ADDICTION, WOMEN, PARTICULARLY THOSE WHO ARE HEADS OF THEIR HOUSEHOLDS, NEED SERVICES THAT SUPPORT THE REESTABLISHMENT OF IMPORTANT FAMILY TIES, CHRYSALIS HOUSE OFFERS FAMILY THERAPY AND FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES. 3. CHILD CARE - CHRYSALIS HOUSE HAS A LICENSED CHILDCARE AND AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN AGE 5-12. LINKAGES HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH OTHER CHILDCARE PROGRAMS IN THE COMMUNITY WHO OFFER CHILDCARE FOR THOSE UNDER THE AGE OF FIVE. CHILD CARE COMMUNITY SUPPORTS ENABLE MOTHERS TO WORK OUTSIDE THE HOME WHILE GAINING SELF-SUFFICIENCY. 4. TRANSPORTATION - CHRYSALIS HOUSE PROVIDES CLIENTS WITH TRANSPORTATION IN BUSINESS VANS, BUS PASSES, AND GAS CARDS TO THOSE CLIENTS IN RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT. FOR LONG TERM COMMUNITY SUPPORT, CASE MANAGERS PROVIDE THEM WITH ASSISTANCE NAVIGATING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS.5. EMPLOYER SUPPORT SERVICES - EMPLOYERS COORDINATE NEEDED JOB SUPPORT SERVICES WITH THE CHRYSALIS HOUSE JOB READINESS COORDINATOR. CHRYSALIS HOUSE CAN BOND WOMEN TO PUT LESS RISK ON THE EMPLOYER SHOULD THEY HIRE A WOMAN IN RECOVERY. 6. VOCATIONAL AND ACADEMIC EDUCATION SERVICES - CRITICAL TO RECOVERY SUCCESS IS THE CONTINUATION OF EDUCATIONAL (FOR WOMEN AND CHILDREN) AND VOCATIONAL SERVICES THAT ARE BEGUN DURING TREATMENT AT CHRYSALIS HOUSE. CHRYSALIS HOUSE OFFERS EACH CLIENT EMPLOYMENT AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING INSTRUCTION FOR THE GENERAL EQUIVALENCY DIPLOMA (GED), JOB SKILLS TRAINING, BASIC AND ADVANCED COMPUTER TRAINING AND JOB PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE.7. CHRYSALIS HOUSE OFFERS WEEKLY FAMILY EDUCATION DAY EVENTS WHERE FAMILY MEMBERS CAN GET INVOLVED IN UNDERSTANDING THEIR ROLES IN THE FAMILY AND HOW THOSE ROLES MAY HAVE BECOME MALADAPTIVE COPING STRATEGIES WHILE THE PERSON SERVED WAS IN ACTIVE ADDICTION. THE EDUCATION DAYS ARE ALSO MEANT TO PROVIDE BASIC EDUCATION ABOUT SUBSTANCE MISUSE, DRUGS OF ABUSE, AND CONCEPTS OF RECOVERY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CHRYSALIS HOUSE OPENED A NEW OUTPATIENT CLINIC, LOCATED AT SERENITY PLACE APARTMENTS. THIS WILL ALLOW CLIENTS A SMOOTH TRANSITION FOR RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT TO A LOWER LEVEL OF CARE IN AN OUTPATIENT SETTING. AFTERCARE PROGRAMING ALSO INCLUDES SOBER LIVING HOUSING OPTIONS. SOME WOMEN TRANSITIONS FROM RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT TO PERMANENT HOUSING AT SERENITY PLACE APARTMENTS, OWNED BY CHRYSALIS HOUSE, OR ONE OF OUR HUD FUNDED SCATTTERED SITE APARTMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS CLASSIFIED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS USING THE "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" APPROACH AS DEFINED IN THE ASC. NO LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHRYSALIS HOUSE PROVIDES SOME CREDIT COUNSELING TO ITS CLIENTS. HOWEVER, REFERRALS ARE MADE TO OTHER AGENCIES WHEN EXTENSIVE CREDIT COUNSELING IS NEEDED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS SUE CHENAULT AND ROWENA RUFF HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP. BOARD MEMBERS LINDY KARNS AND NEAL VAUGHAN HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP. BOARD MEMBERS ANGELA RICE, ROBERT MAY, AND WILLIAM DRAKE HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO BE REVIEWED BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY ANNUALLY REQUESTING THIS INFORMATION FROM THE BOARD MEMBERS AND REVIEWING IT WITH ALL NEW BOARD MEMBERS. ALL EMPLOYEES MUST DISCLOSE OUTSIDE EMPLOYMENT OR ENGAGEMENT IN CONSULTING FOR OTHERS IN WRITING, PRIOR TO THE COMMENCEMENT OF SUCH OUTSIDE EMPLOYMENT OR CONSULTING TO HUMAN RESOURCES, UNLESS IT IS BEYOND DISPUTE THAT SUCH ACTIVITY COULD NOT PRESENT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, OR THE APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ALL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST MUST BE RESOLVED. AUTHORIZATION TO ENGAGE IN CONDUCT THAT CONSTITUTES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR THE APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. IN ORDER TO AVOID CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, CHRYSALIS HOUSE DOES NOT EMPLOY IMMEDIATE FAMILY MEMBERS OF ANY CURRENT EMPLOYEE. VIOLATIONS OF THIS POLICY MAY RESULT IN DISCIPLINE, INCLUDING THE POSSIBILITY OF IMMEDIATE TERMINATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHRYSALIS HOUSE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DETERMINED COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE DETERMINED COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES THROUGH REVIEW OF COMPARABILITY DATA ON O*NET ONLINE, ONLINE 990 REPORTS, AND TELEPHONIC CALLS WITH REGIONAL SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT PROGRAMS. THE COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
THE ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: SUPPORT LONG TERM TREATMENT FOR CHEMICALLY DEPENDENT WOMEN
